subtitle="" delimiter_settings="delimiter_style:solid|delimiter_width:0|delimiter_height:1" undefined="" title_font_options="tag:h2" subtitle_font_options="tag:div"]Rotate, Rotate, Rotate!  Why the Magnificent 7 Won't Dominate Forever and What's Coming Next for Investors[/dfd_heading][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]How long can the Magnificent 7 keep outperforming the market? What stock market indicators are signaling a change in leadership?  Find out how changing global macro themes can impact sector leadership changes in the stock market.  What new sectors will emerge to replace the Magnificent 7?  Attend this talk and learn what the key drivers are behind this new emerging theme.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text]
Attend this talk and you will learn...
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][dfd_icon_list module_animation="transition.slideRightBigIn" list_fields="%5B%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Markets%20have%20fashions%2C%20with%20those%20fashions%20rotating%20every%205-7%20years%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22As%20that%20fashion%20changes%2C%20usually%20dictated%20by%20a%20changing%20global%20macro%20theme%20(think%2C%20the%20rise%20of%20China%2C%20the%20housing%20boom%2C%20and%20various%20new%20waves%20of%20tech%20advancement)%2C%20then%20the%20global%20sector%20leadership%20changes%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22This%20current(tech)%20leadership%20has%20been%20impressive%20but%20is%20also%20%5C%22long%20in%20the%20tooth%5C%22.%20%20A%20new%20macro%20theme%20is%20set%20to%20emerge%20this%20year%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Why%20the%20macroeconomic%20landscape%20%20suggests%20greater%20respect%20for%20risk%20than%20many%20are%20willing%20to%20give%20markets%20right%20now%22%7D%5D" icon_border="border_style:none|border_color:%2334d288" main_style="style-1" icon_size="20" icon_color="#5e67bb" font_options="tag:h6|color:%2334d288"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][vc_column_text]Prior to founding Longview Economics, Chris Watling worked in the City of London for 12 years with Cazenove and CAI Cheuvreux as a global economist and strategist. He also held roles as an equity analyst and corporate financier at Cazenove in the mid 1990s. He qualified as a chartered accountant with KPMG and holds master's and bachelor's degrees in economics. He regularly chairs and speaks at global investment conferences, is often quoted in the financial press and appears frequently on CNBC, Bloomberg and other media outlets. He is also an ambassador for WeSeeHope, a charity that supports children and young people in sub-Saharan Africa affected by HIV/AIDS.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" title_font_options="font_size:20"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" col_shadow_hover="box_shadow_enable:disable|shadow_horizontal:0|shadow_vertical:15|shadow_blur:50|shadow_spread:0|box_shadow_color:rgba(0%2C0%2C0%2C0.35)"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][dfd_heading subtitle="" delimiter_settings="delimiter_style:solid|delimiter_width:0|delimiter_height:1" undefined="" title_font_options="tag:h2" subtitle_font_options="tag:div"]Suffering from Bond Strategy Fatigue? The Doctor is in[/dfd_heading][vc_column_text]Bond investors have been put through the ringer the past few years.  There’s still good value in bond land and Marilyn will show you how to ferret out some good yieldy choices.  There’s a right way and not so right way to select individual bonds for a portfolio. You will learn the rules of the road.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text]
Attend this presentation to...
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][dfd_icon_list module_animation="transition.slideRightBigIn" list_fields="%5B%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Learn%20the%20superiority%20of%20owning%20individual%20bonds%20versus%20open%20end%2C%20closed%20end%20and%20ETF%20bond%20funds%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Learn%20what%20not%20to%20invest%20in%20and%20why%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Walk%20away%20with%20actionable%20recommendations%2C%20names%20you%20may%20not%20be%20familiar%20with%22%7D%5D" icon_border="border_style:none|border_color:%2334d288" main_style="style-1" icon_size="20" icon_color="#5e67bb" font_options="tag:h6|color:%2334d288"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][vc_column_text]Marilyn Cohen is one of the country’s top bond managers. She began her financial career as a securities analyst at William O’Neil & Co. She later moved into bond brokerage at Cantor Fitzgerald Inc. She founded Envision Capital Management, where she is CEO, 24 years ago. Her company specializes in managing bond portfolios for individuals. Cohen writes the bond column appearing in Forbes magazine and has authored five books that teach individuals how to profitably invest in bonds. Cohen is a popular guest on CNBC, FOX Business News, PBS and each of the major broadcast networks.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_separator color="blue"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/6"][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][vc_column width="2/3"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1639077484345{background-color: #b5ffb6 !important;}"][/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/6"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: Financial Education meeting information that focuses on the broad overview of basic individual investing in today's market.
